meanings.definition: A person who is at home in all countries.
meanings.sent1: The cosmopolite traveled to many different countries and felt comfortable in each one.
meanings.sent2: As a cosmopolite, she easily adapted to the customs and languages of various nations.
meanings.sent3: The cosmopolite joked that their passport had more stamps than a collector's album.
meanings.sent4: She was a true cosmopolite, a citizen of the world with no borders in her heart.
meanings.sent5: The cosmopolite's wanderlust knew no bounds, always seeking new horizons to explore.

meanings.definition: A person who is free from local, provincial, or national bias or attachment.
meanings.sent1: Being a cosmopolite, he viewed all cultures with an open mind and without prejudice.
meanings.sent2: The cosmopolite believed in unity among all people, regardless of their origins.
meanings.sent3: The cosmopolite humorously claimed that their favorite color was 'world peace'.
meanings.sent4: Her cosmopolite nature made her see humanity as one big family sharing the same planet.
meanings.sent5: The cosmopolite's heart was a mosaic of diverse beliefs and values, blending harmoniously.
